intro: Smithia recurvifolia, commonly known as the recurved smithia, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically narrow and recurved, giving it a distinctive appearance. Smithia recurvifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
